alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Franklin; Licking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 3:08PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN FRANKLIN, SOUTHEASTERN DELAWARE AND WESTERN LICKING COUNTIES THROUGH 345 PM EDT... At 307 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Ohio State University, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Newark, Dublin, Westerville, Reynoldsburg, Upper Arlington, Gahanna, Hilliard, Worthington, Bexley, Heath, Granville, Pataskala, Johnstown, Sunbury, Minerva Park, Granville South, Ohio State University, Beechwood Trails and Polaris. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 96 and 111, and between mile markers 114 and 117. I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 103 and 127. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
